~~Adds more debugging to analyse https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/7649~~

Still contains the debugging, but mainly now a fix for #7649.

The diff has too little content to see what the problem is, so here is a larger section:

```diff
 		cfg, ok := m.cfg.Folder(folder.ID)
 		if ok {
 			folderDevice, ok = cfg.Device(deviceID)
 		}
 		if !ok {
 			indexSenders.remove(folder.ID)
 			if deviceCfg.IgnoredFolder(folder.ID) {
 				l.Infof("Ignoring folder %s from device %s since we are configured to", folder.Description(), deviceID)
 				continue
 			}
 			delete(expiredPending, folder.ID)
 			of.Label = folder.Label
 			of.ReceiveEncrypted = len(ccDeviceInfos[folder.ID].local.EncryptionPasswordToken) > 0
 			if err := m.db.AddOrUpdatePendingFolder(folder.ID, of, deviceID); err != nil {
 				l.Warnf("Failed to persist pending folder entry to database: %v", err)
 			}
-			indexSenders.addPending(cfg, ccDeviceInfos[folder.ID])
+			indexSenders.addPending(folder.ID, ccDeviceInfos[folder.ID])
```

The `cfg` at this point is just an empty/default object. Thus in `addPending` when using `cfg.ID`, that's an empty string.

issue.body:
I am sorry for the long title, but I am not sure how exactly to describe this.

How to reproduce:

1. Create and share an empty folder between 3 devices - A, B, and C.
2. Add one large file to the folder on A.
3. While still syncing, pause the folder on A.
4. Wait for B and C to mark the folder "Out of Sync".

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/107113860-0ce29300-68a5-11eb-8960-e67308241a53.png)
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/107113862-0eac5680-68a5-11eb-8468-bbd852b2e401.png)
![3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/107113864-0f44ed00-68a5-11eb-8e38-2130d11e4882.png)

5. Unpause the folder on A.
6. B and C are stuck trying to download the file.
7. In this state, add two more large files to the folder on A.
8. The two new files get properly pushed to B and C, but the first file gets "forgotten" in the process.

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/107113913-5d59f080-68a5-11eb-807c-199018121b28.png)
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/107113915-5f23b400-68a5-11eb-866b-715523336132.png)
![3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/107113916-60ed7780-68a5-11eb-92db-1aa864391dd3.png)

9. The folder is marked "Up to Date" on all three devices, but the states differ, and A is stuck trying to push the first file to B and C.

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/107113752-4c5caf80-68a4-11eb-9c23-910ed16f4846.png)
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/107113754-4e267300-68a4-11eb-8442-636c4ebb35fb.png)
![3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5626656/107113756-4f57a000-68a4-11eb-9e99-756483bf73f3.png)

10. Restarting Syncthing on A, B, or C makes no difference.

Logs with `STTRACE=db,model`:

[syncthing1.log](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/files/5936514/syncthing1.log)
[syncthing2.log](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/files/5936515/syncthing2.log)
[syncthing3.log](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/files/5936516/syncthing3.log)

I also would like to add that the testing was done with v1.13.1, but I can reproduce this behaviour using the current `main` (`v1.13.2-dev.36.g6db8dc33`) too.

issue.title: lib/model: Ensure indexes are only received after checking IDs (ref #7649)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
### Purpose

This change would have prevented the db/index corruption even if the bug that caused #7649 is present. It ensures that indexes are only ever received after checking IDs, regardless of the order methods are called in model. Getting the order right in the model is hard, as it involves multiple, intertwined inputs (connections being established/closed, local config changes, remote config changes, ...).

The main change here is to move receiving indexes/writing them to the db into what is currently the `indexSender` (renamed to `indexHandler`). Checking indexIDs happens when starting/creating an index handler, thus it's now impossible to receive indexes before checking IDs.

Git doesn't pick up the the rename as there's too many changed lines, however the diff is actually quite sane with one function moved verbatim. Thus I recommend looking at the diff without the first commits:  
https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/pull/7689/files/adfb666f486503e6f63803de3a2831adaa4fa9a9..0e7a416c77bbd80556b1646be6073e7f6c9c7152
 
### Testing

Due to the stricter conditions on receiving indexes a lot of tests now require a (fake) connection to work. Somehow that resulted in more usage of `fakeFS` and triggered a crash there, thus the lone change to lib/fs.
